revised_title: Objective Criteria for Selecting Indicator Taxa in Biodiversity Assessment
tldr: This article discusses the importance of using objective criteria to select indicator taxa for the quantitative assessment of biodiversity. The author presents seven criteria that can be used to test the suitability of a taxon as an ideal indicator, such as well-known taxonomy, natural history, and distribution across habitats. The article emphasizes the need for objectivity in selecting indicator taxa to reduce uncertainty, increase efficiency, and improve communication of results.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Conservation
